title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.14.22 - 29 | 14-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: This chapter deals with the topic of the disappearance of Lord Krishna and we have come to the portion where Yudhishthira Maharaj has observed bad omens and is conjecturing the disappearance of Lord Krishna
segments.summary: The lecture begins with an introduction to the verses being discussed, focusing on Yudhishthira's observation of bad omens and his concern about Krishna's disappearance.

segments.key_quote: Just when he was talking to Bhima, Arjuna returned, came back from the city of Dwarka.
segments.summary: This segment describes Arjuna's return from Dwarka in a state of dejection, with tears in his eyes, which Yudhishthira observes with concern.

segments.key_quote: seeing Arjuna pale due to heartfelt anxieties, the king, that is Yudhishthira, remembering the indications of the sage Narada
segments.summary: Yudhishthira, seeing Arjuna's distress, recalls Narada's prophecy about staying until Krishna's departure and wonders if Krishna has left.

segments.key_quote: My dear brother, please tell me whether our friend, friends and relatives such as Madhu, Bhoja, Dasharha, Aarha, Satvata, Andhaka, and the members of the Yadu family are all passing their days in happiness.
segments.summary: Yudhishthira inquires about the well-being of the various clans and kings of the Yadu dynasty, who were devotees and associates of Krishna.

segments.key_quote: The meaning of this verse is, heâ€Ž is my respectable grand father, Shuru Sena, in a happy mood. And are my maternal uncle Vasudeva and his younger brothers all doing well?
segments.summary: Yudhishthira specifically asks about his maternal grandfather, Shurusena, and his maternal uncle, Vasudeva, and their well-being.

segments.key_quote: The translation of this verse is, his seven wives, headed by Devaki, are all sisters. Are they and their sons and daughters-in-law all happy?
segments.summary: Yudhishthira inquires about the welfare of Vasudeva's seven wives, headed by Devaki, and their children and daughters-in-law.

segments.key_quote: Yudhishthira to Arjuna specifically is asking about the different relatives of Krishna living with him in Dwaraka.
segments.summary: Yudhishthira asks Arjuna about specific relatives of Krishna in Dwaraka, including Balarama, and also inquires about the situation in Mathura.

segments.key_quote: Because Lord Balarama is the immediate expansion of Vishnu Tattva as Prakasha Vigraha of Lord Krishna.
segments.summary: This segment explains the concept of Vishnu Tattva and how Balarama is the immediate expansion of Krishna, possessing the same qualities and power.

segments.key_quote: One who considers the Vishnu Tattva and the Jeeva Shakti to be on equal level is considered a condemned soul of the world.
segments.summary: This segment differentiates between Vishnu Tattva and Jeeva Shakti, emphasizing the superiority of the former, and highlights Balarama as the original guru and Prabhupada as his merciful representative.
